predicate.note: Frames file for 'fascinate' based on sentences in wsj. Verbnet entry 31.1, Framenet entry Experiencer obj.

example.name: passive
example.text: And, since the public has always been fascinated *trace* by gossip and voyeurism, reporters and editors will strain for creative angles to justify the inclusion of collateral facts about private lives including sexual activities and domestic relationships, activities of family members, and all matters about mental and physical health.

example.name: with instrument
example.text: John fascinated Mary with his tales of adventure in the Great White North.
example.arg: his tales of adventure in the Great White North
